turtleGraphics.turtle

Class TurtleProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • turtleGraphics.turtle.TurtleProgram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, TurtleObserver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TurtleExercise

    public abstract class TurtleProgram
extends javax.swing.JComponent
implements TurtleObserver
    Base class for applets rendering turtle graphics to the screen. Displays an animated turtle sprite to show the turtle's current state.

    To change the speed of turtle animations, call setTurtleSpeedFactor(double). To draw as fast as possible, set the speed factor to 0.

    See Also:
    Turtle, Serialized Form

      • add

        public void add(Turtle turtle)
        Places the given turtle on the virtual paper. Subsequent turtle actions will draw to this applet's window.

      • remove

        public void remove(Turtle turtle)
        Removes the given turtle from the virtual paper.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears the paper to white. Does not remove any turtles.

      • setTurtleSpeedFactor

        public void setTurtleSpeedFactor(double factor)
        Controls the speed of all turtle animations. Zero makes animation run as fast as possible. The default is 1000.

      • setTurtleSize

        public void setTurtleSize(double size)
        Resizes the sprites of all turtles currently on the canvas. Does not affect drawing.

      • setTurtlesVisible

        public void setTurtlesVisible(boolean turtlesVisible)
        Shows or hides the turtle sprites. Does not affect drawing.

      • turtleMoved

        public void turtleMoved(Turtle turtle,
                        double x0,
                        double y0,
                        double x1,
                        double y1)
        Description copied from interface: TurtleObserver
        Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message. The turtle traveled from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1).

        This method is not called when the turtle is moved by a setter method such as Turtle.setX(double); setters represent discontinuous motion, and thus result in a call to TurtleObserver.turtleChanged(Turtle);

        Specified by:
        turtleMoved in interface TurtleObserver

      • turtleTurned

        public void turtleTurned(Turtle turtle,
                         double oldDir,
                         double newDir)
        Description copied from interface: TurtleObserver
        Called after a turtle has handled a forward() or backward() message. The turtle traveled from (x0,y0) to (x1,y1).
        Specified by:
        turtleTurned in interface TurtleObserver

      • turtleChanged

        public void turtleChanged(Turtle turtle)
        Description copied from interface: TurtleObserver
        Called after any turtle state change not handled by this interface's other methods. This includes, for exmaple, a change in color, pen up/down, or a change due to an absolute setter method.
        Specified by:
        turtleChanged in interface TurtleObserver
